code:
const homeText = "You have made it to Marc Munic's Homepage.  It is on a Github Server (if you couldn't figure that out from the URL) and uses React.  It is also using Redux, which I agree, is a bit overkill for such a simple site, but then again I like to keep even the simplest things stupidly scalable.  I learned to use CSS clip-path on the images on the home screen.  I also spent probably more time than I should converting from NPM to Yarn and switching the lock packages, but I had to because I had ran into an issue with my gh-pages package and my es-lint package.  One feature that would never be noticed unless pointed out, is the year in the copyright line is automated to the current year.";
export default homeText;
